internal and operational functions and&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in severance charges related to personnel reductions in the Film and Electrolytic segment resulting from a reorganization of the segment's management structure.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The relocation and exit costs of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;were primarily related to the relocation of axial electrolytic production equipment from the plant in Granna, Sweden to the Company's plant in Evora, Portugal.</span></div><div><a id="sEF40832A4E775CEE8F97549EBEE8400F"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Operating Income</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Operating income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$136.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">declined</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$10.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from operating income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$146.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The decrease in operating income was primarily attributable to a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in restructuring charges, a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in R&amp;D expenses, and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decline</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in gross margin. Also contributing to the decrease in operating income was a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> increase in net loss on write down and disposal of long-lived assets. These unfavorable changes to operating income were partially offset by a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in SG&amp;A expenses. </span></div><div><a id="s469871189D1257FBAE6E3532D961DABB"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Operating (Income) Expense, Net</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Non-operating expense, net was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$70.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to non-operating expense, net of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$24.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$46.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> increase in non-operating expense, net was primarily attributable to a $60.2 million increase in antitrust class action settlements and regulatory costs. Also contributing to the increase in non-operating expense, net was an $11.7 million unfavorable change in foreign currency exchange (gain) loss, which was primarily due currency fluctuations in the Thai Bhat, Chinese Yuan, Japanese Yen and British Pound and a $4.5 million decrease in R&amp;D grant reimbursements and grant income. These unfavorable changes were partially offset by a $16.0 million loss on the early extinguishment of debt that occurred during the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> when the Company refinanced its term loan, compared to no such loss during the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Additionally, net interest expense decreased $11.9 million from the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> due to the debt refinancing. A $0.8 million increase in net derivative interest income and a $0.8 million unrealized gain on equity securities recognized during the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> also benefited non-operating (income) expense, net.</span></div><div><a id="sECC1C00DD7C056C5ACFC65D3C6B5B798"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Income Taxes</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$23.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$14.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$23.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was comprised of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$13.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of income tax expense related to foreign operations, </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of federal income tax expense, and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of state income tax expense. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Income tax expense of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was comprised of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of income tax expense related to foreign operations and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of state income tax benefit. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of income tax expense related to foreign operations included a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> benefit related to the final settlement of an uncertain tax position. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">49</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The effective tax rates differ from income taxes recorded using a statutory rate largely due to the impact of certain nondeductible items, the relative mix in earnings and losses in various tax jurisdictions, the usage of the net operating losses, and reversal of associated valuation allowances previously recorded on the deferred tax assets.</span></div><div><a id="sFEEDD488267953B48AD9A7AAE69C7440"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Equity Income (Loss) from Equity Method Investments</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;"></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Equity income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> had a favorable change of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to an equity loss of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The change was primarily related to a $0.4 million gain associated with the Novasentis acquisition as a result of the Company adjusting its investment balance in Novasentis to fair value prior to its acquisition during the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">50</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in net sales was primarily driven by </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a $52.5 million decrease in Tantalum net sales, which was mostly offset by a $50.2 million increase in Ceramics net sales. The decrease in Tantalum net sales was primarily due to a $49.5 million decrease in distributor net sales across the Americas, APAC, and EMEA regions, a $5.2 million decrease in EMS net sales in the Americas region, and a $2.9 million decrease in OEM net sales across the EMEA and JPKO regions. These decreases in Tantalum net sales were partially offset by a $2.4 million increase in OEM net sales across the Americas and APAC regions, a $1.6 million increase in distributor net sales in the JPKO region, and a $1.2 million increase in EMS net sales in the APAC region. The increase in Ceramics net sales was primarily due to a $25.3 million increase in distributor net sales across all regions, a $13.2 million increase in EMS net sales across regions, and an $11.9 million increase in OEM net sales across all regions except for the JPKO region. These increases in Ceramics net sales were partially offset by a $0.2 million decrease in OEM net sales in the JKPO region. Solid Capacitors net sales was unfavorably impacted by $4.2 million from foreign currency exchange due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. Dollar. </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Segment Operating Income </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Segment operating income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$271.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$21.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$249.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in operating income was primarily a result of a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$21.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in gross margin, which was driven by </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">continued variable margin improvement resulting from manufacturing process improvements, vertical integration, and ongoing restructuring activities, as well as a favorable shift in sales mix and channel. Price increases for certain products also contributed to the increase in gross margin.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Also contributing to the increase in operating income was a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in SG&amp;A expenses and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in net loss on write down and disposal of long-lived assets. These improvements to operating income were partially offset by a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">51</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in restructuring charges and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in R&amp;D expenses for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div><a id="sA70ACFDD5656574F8C5D768FC01C2180"></a></div><div channel and region mix.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> The unfavorable change in operating income was also attributable to a </span><span </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in SG&amp;A expenses for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Net Sales</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">MSA net sales of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$150.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$33.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$183.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in net sales was primarily driven by </span><span>a $32.9 million decrease in OEM net sales across all regions except for the EMEA region and a $1.2 million decrease in distributor net sales in the APAC region. These decreases in net sales were partially offset by a $1.1 million increase in distributor net sales across the Americas and EMEA regions. MSA net sales was</span><span> </span><span>favorably impacted by $2.1 million from foreign currency exchange due to the change in the value of the Japanese Yen compared to the U.S. dollar.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">52</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Segment Operating Income </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Segment operating income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$11.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decreased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from segment operating income of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$19.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in operating income was primarily a result of a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$14.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in gross margin, which was driven by </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">a decrease in net sales and an unfavorable shift in sales mix.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> This decrease to operating income was partially offset by a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in SG&amp;A expenses, a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in restructuring charges, and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in R&amp;D expenses for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">53</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s5467E1BC72D657C0A206C0DA5404015B"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Liquidity and Capital Resources</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Our liquidity needs arise from working capital requirements, capital expenditures, acquisitions, principal and interest payments on debt, costs associated with the implementation of our restructuring plans, and in the past, dividend payments.&#160;Historically, our cash needs have been met by cash flows from operations, borrowings under our loan agreements, and existing cash balances.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">TOKIN Term Loan Facility &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On October 29, 2018, the Company entered into a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">JPY 33.0 billion</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Term Loan Agreement (the &#8220;TOKIN Term Loan Facility&#8221;) by and among TOKIN Corporation (&#8220;TOKIN&#8221;), the lenders party thereto (the &#8220;Lenders&#8221;) and Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Bank, Limited in its capacity as agent (the &#8220;Agent&#8221;), arranger and Lender. Funding for the TOKIN Term Loan Facility occurred on November 7, 2018. The proceeds, which were net of an arrangement fee withheld from the funding amount, were </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">JPY 32.1 billion</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$283.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> using the exchange rate as of November 7, 2018. The carrying value of the TOKIN Term Loan Facility at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$270.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Revolving Line of Credit</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The revolving line of credit has a facility amount of up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$75.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which is based on factors including outstanding eligible accounts receivable, inventory, and equipment collateral. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, there were </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">no</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> borrowings under the revolving line of credit, and the Company&#8217;s available borrowing capacity, which is based on factors including outstanding eligible accounts receivable, inventory and equipment collateral, under the Revolver Amendment was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$62.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Customer Advances</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company has received a total of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$45.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">in customer advances from three separate customers (&#8220;Customer Capacity Agreements&#8221;). The Customer Capacity Agreements are being used to fund the expansion of capacity for various electronic components that are sold to these customers. Since the debt is non-interest bearing, the Company has recorded debt discounts on the advances.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> T</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">hese discounts will be amortized over the expected life of the Advances through interest expense.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The carrying value of this debt at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$34.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the nine months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$28.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in capital expenditures related to the Customer Capacity Agreements.</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">As of</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in cash that was restricted to be used to fund these Investments. Restricted cash is recorded within &#8220;Prepaid expenses and other current assets&#8221; in the Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Short-Term Liquidity</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Cash and cash equivalents as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$208.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$207.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Our net working capital (current assets less current liabilities) as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$380.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> compared to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$363.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Cash and cash equivalents held by our foreign subsidiaries totaled $148.0 million and $139.6 million at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">March&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, with the increase primarily driven by higher cash in Japan and Mexico, partially offset by lower cash in Taiwan, Singapore and Thailand. Our operating income outside the U.S. is not deemed to be permanently reinvested in foreign jurisdictions. However, we currently do not intend nor foresee a need to repatriate cash and cash equivalents held by foreign subsidiaries. If these funds are needed for our operations in the U.S., we may be required to accrue U.S. withholding taxes on the distributed foreign earnings.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Based on our current operating plans, we believe cash and cash equivalents, including expected cash generated from operations, are sufficient to fund our operating requirements for at least the next twelve months, including </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$58.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in payments for antitrust class action settlements and regulatory costs, </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$29.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in debt principal payments, approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in interest payments, and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in restructuring payments.&#160;As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, our borrowing capacity, which is based on factors including outstanding eligible accounts receivable, inventory and equipment collateral, under the revolving line of credit was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$62.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.&#160;The revolving line of credit expires on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">April&#160;28, 2022</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Cash, cash equivalents, and restricted cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increased</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, as compared to a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$49.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> during the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">54</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Operating</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">provided by</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities totaled </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$90.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">provided by</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$82.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> during the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">provided by</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities was positively impacted by net income. Operating cash flows were negatively impacted by the effects of a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$20.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">decrease</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in operating liabilities and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$7.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">increase</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in operating assets. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">provided by</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> operating activities was positively impacted by net income. Operating cash flows were negatively impacted by the effects of a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$61.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> decrease in operating liabilities and a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$42.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> increase in operating assets. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Investing</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">used in</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> investing activities totaled </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$105.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$78.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">used in</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> investing activities included capital expenditures of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$104.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, primarily related to expanding capacity at our manufacturing locations in Mexico, China, Thailand, and Japan, as well as information technology projects across the world. Customer Capacity Agreements made up </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$28.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$104.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in capital expenditures. Additionally, the Company made a contribution of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to KEMET Jianghai and used </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in cash to purchase the remaining ownership interests in Novasentis. Partially offsetting these uses of cash was the receipt of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> from the settlement of the net investment hedge and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in dividends from our equity method investments.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">used in</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> investing activities included capital expenditures of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$77.7 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, primarily related to expanding capacity at our manufacturing locations in Mexico, Portugal, China, Thailand, and Japan, as well as information technology projects in the United States and Mexico. Additionally, we made capital contributions to KEMET Jianghai and Novasentis totaling </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.0 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Partially offsetting these uses of cash was the receipt of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in dividends from our equity method investments and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in proceeds from the sale of assets.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Financing</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">provided by</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> financing activities totaled </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$15.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and during the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">used in</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> financing activities totaled </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$46.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company received </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$31.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in customer advances related to the Customer Capacity Agreements. Additionally, the Company received </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> upon the termination of cross-currency swaps. Partially offsetting these cash inflows was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$13.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in long-term debt repayments, </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$5.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in dividend payments, and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.8 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> used to settle cash flow hedges. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended December 31, 2018</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, cash </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">used in</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> financing activities included </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$332.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in long-term debt repayments on the Company's prior term loan, which was fully repaid during fiscal year 2019. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$332.1 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in payments on long term debt included two quarterly payments of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.3 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, for a total of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$8.6 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$323.4 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;to repay the remaining balance on the Company's prior term loan. An early payment premium on that term loan used&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.2 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in cash and the Company also made one quarterly dividend payment of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$2.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Partially offsetting these uses of cash was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$283.9 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in proceeds from the TOKIN Term Loan Facility and&#160;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in customer advances related to the Customer Capacity Agreements. Additionally, the Company generated </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.5 million</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in cash from the exercise of stock options. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">55</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s20FD0C20B7F75C6D958DAAF3EBE136AC"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Commitments</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">With the exception of the items noted below, our commitments have not materially changed from those disclosed in the&#160;Company&#8217;s </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Form 10-K. style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-indent:48px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">To complement our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and Cash Flows, we use non-GAAP financial measures of adjusted gross margin, adjusted SG&amp;A expenses, adjusted operating income, adjusted net income, EBITDA, adjusted EBITDA, and certain related ratios.&#160;Management believes that these non-GAAP financial measures are complements to GAAP amounts and such measures are useful to investors.&#160;The presentation of these non-GAAP measures is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to net income as an indicator of our performance, or, in the case of EBITDA, as an alternative to cash flows from operating activities as a measure of liquidity.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span
